page.title: 07FARMING IN 1885
page.content: machinery, they did not. Cow milking was also different, the farmers would have a big shed and cubicles. The cows would be taken one at a time because the farmer would have a stool, bucket and churns. He would his stool next to the cow on the right hand side and place his bucket under her udders. With a pulling and squeezing motion he would milk the cow's udders and then go to the other cows and gather milk from them in the same way. The farmer had to sit on the right hand side otherwise he would probably be kicked by the cow who was rather sensitive. Today we have machinery to milk the cows, there are clusters which fit on the cow's udders and a bulk tank which holds the milk after it comes through pipes from the milking parlour.
